title: European greenhouse gas emissions decline but land stores weaken
summary: According to recent research, Europe’s net greenhouse gas emissions have decreased by around 25% since the 1990s. While this is good news, the study also revealed a weakening in the capacity of land and vegetation to absorb and store atmospheric carbon.

title: NASA’s Webb Reveals Distorted Galaxy Forming Cosmic Question Mark
summary: It’s 7 billion years ago, and the universe’s heyday of star formation is beginning to slow. What might our Milky Way galaxy have looked like at that time? Astronomers using NASA’s James Webb Space Telescope have found clues in the form of a cosmic question mark, the result of a rare alignment across light-years of […]

title: Space Station AMS-02 Instrument Works on the Mystery of Dark Matter
summary: Visible matter in the form of stars and planets adds up to about five percent of the total known mass of the Universe. The rest is either dark matter, antimatter, or dark energy. The exact nature of these substances is unknown, but the International Space Station’s Alpha-Magnetic Spectrometer or AMS-02 is helping to solve the […]

title: Atlas sets course to triple sales after raising $15 million
summary: Ground station services provider Atlas Space Operations said Sept. 4 it has raised $15 million for the working capital needed to triple revenue over the next 12 months.

title: Relativity Space has gone from printing money and rockets to doing what, exactly?
summary: "I would rather make that decision than pathologically hold on to something."
